content:
I am a third-year Ph.D student in the theory group of UC Berkeley, where I’m very lucky to be advised by Venkatesan Guruswami.
I have a broad interest in theoretical computer science, especially in Computational Complexity and Hardness of Approximation.
During my undergrad, I was fortunate to work with Prof. Bingkai Lin on Parameterized Inapproximability, with Prof. Huacheng Yu on Sketching Complexity, and with Prof. Pinyan Lu on Algorithms with Predictions.
Email: xuandi_ren@berkeley.edu

content: My name in Chinese is 任轩笛. I used to participate in algorithm competitions during high school and college. I won a gold medal at IOI 2018. I play a bit of many sports, though I'm not particularly good at any of them — basketball, tennis, badminton, and table tennis, to name a few. I'm deeply passionate about music. I played piano for over a decade during my childhood, and my favorite composers are Beethoven and Chopin. I also enjoy listening to Chinese pop and rock music — see here for details. I'm also into some hardcore games, especially roguelike and action titles. My favorite games include DOTA 2, Slay the Spire, The Binding of Isaac, and Elden Ring. I enjoy playing Japanese Mahjong — I reached the 雀圣 (Master) rank on the platform Mahjong Soul. Feel free to check out my Bilibili account for some of my game clips.
